content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player, I would analyze the payoff structure of this game to make an informed decision.

In each round, picking R nets me 45$ when my opponent picks R too, but 0$ if they pick B. On the other hand, if I pick R while they choose B, they earn 42$, and I get nothing. This means that choosing R is profitable only when both players make the same choice.

However, in a best-case scenario where my opponent chooses R every time, I would earn (75 * 45) = $3,375 during the entire game. In this case, if my opponent occasionally makes a mistake and chooses B, there's a significant potential loss due to the zero payout when they pick B and I pick R.

When I pick B instead, I earn 12$ per round regardless of my opponent's choice, so I'd get (75 * 12) = $900 during the entire game. This is a smaller amount compared to choosing R when the opponent always chooses R, but it's also less risky due to the guaranteed payout.

Given that this is an anonymous game and I don't know my opponent's strategy, I would choose B for a more conservative approach to minimize potential losses and still earn some money during the 75 rounds. This means my choice would be {B}. However, if I were confident that my opponent would consistently pick R, then it might make sense to choose R as well for higher earnings (but at greater risk).
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

With both of us choosing B in the first round and earning a payout of 12$, I will stick with my strategy of playing B for the second round as well. This decision ensures that I continue to earn some money while minimizing the risk of zero payout, given the unknown strategy of my opponent.

So, for the next round, I would choose {B}.
